meanings.definition: Aerofoils: a structure designed to produce lift or control the flow of air in a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The aerofoils on the airplane help it stay up in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The engineer designed the aerofoils to make the plane fly smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The aerofoils on the toy plane made it soar high above the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her outstretched arms acted like aerofoils, catching the wind and lifting her off the ground.
meanings.sent5: The aerofoils on the kite caught the wind, sending it soaring into the sky.

meanings.definition: Aerofoils: aerofoils are used in aircraft to provide lift and control.
meanings.sent1: The pilot adjusted the aerofoils to change the plane's altitude.
meanings.sent2: Aircraft engineers carefully design aerofoils to ensure safe flights.
meanings.sent3: The aerofoils on the model airplane made it glide gracefully through the air.
meanings.sent4: The aerofoils of the aircraft sliced through the clouds, heading towards its destination.
meanings.sent5: The aerofoils of the helicopter whirred loudly as it lifted off the ground.
